file_content.text: Code name Legate to base command. Come in, base command.
Base command receiving, Legate.
Don't be surprised if I cut out; the whole Hoth system is murder on the comms. Not so good for people, either.
I'll keep the signal clear. What's my mission?
Acknowledged.
You say that like you've had experience.
You sound familiar with it.
Not personally. Friends.
Is that why you've sent your most expendable asset?
Good thing I'm disposable.
No one's expendable. Different skills merit different assignments.
Hoth's a frozen rock. Not worth much on its own, but years back, it saw one of the war's big battles.
Hundreds of ships got dragged into the atmosphere, made a sort of "starship graveyard" for the best girls in the fleet. You're going to bring one home.
I hijacked a transport once. Never made off with a whole ship.
I'm stealing a ship?
I heard rumors. Tell me the story some day.
There's got to be a catch.
That's suspiciously simple.
I'm not committing treason just to play scavenger.
Go find a salvage team.
This isn't a scavenger hunt.
It's a war zone down there. Republic salvage operations, Imperial saboteurs... and the White Maw. Few thousand pirates who want the scrap for themselves.
Plus, the Starbreeze is a mu-type shuttle. Slip of a thing; haven't been able to locate her in the wreckage. Our only lead is inside the Imperial Army.
That explains why you needed a defector.
So you brought me in.
What makes the SIS want this shuttle so badly?
Why's this ship important?
The Starbreeze belongs to the Republic. It's important to us. That's all I can say for now.
If this ship is special, I need to know why. What if I find it damaged? Is it carrying dangerous cargo?
I can't work in ignorance.
Assume that the Starbreeze is exactly what it seems, and try to preserve its condition. I have faith in your abilities.
You don't completely trust me. I understand.
Very well.
Give it time. You don't trust me, either, but we'll work together to help this galaxy.
You locked down my mind. Now you can't even explain the mission?
The brainwashing isn't enough?
You chose to work with the SIS. I'm treating you like I would any new agent.
If you want me to hurt Imperials directly, you'll have to force me.
Don't make me fight my people.
You have a code, I respect that. I'm not asking you to break it yet.
We have reports that Layek Davos--an Imperial admiral who fought in the Battle of Hoth--is assembling an expedition to the starship graveyard.
He's after a long list of salvage, the Starbreeze included. Join Admiral Davos and get that shuttle to us instead.
Do you plan to explain what you need this shuttle for?
You still haven't said why.
When it's all over, I promise.
You'll have the ship before the admiral knows it's gone.
Understood.
If I steal the admiral's prize, it won't be long before someone figures it out.
Won't that blow my cover?
You're craftier than that. You do this right, no one has to know.
I'll do the job. If you're holding anything back....
Don't try to play me.
You know everything you'll need.
Code name Hunter will contact you from the field; he's en route to Hoth now.
In the meantime, talk to Admiral Davos's Search and Recovery men at the Imperial base. With any luck, they'll show us the way.
In the meantime, talk to Admiral Davos's Search and Recovery men at the Imperial base, and get the Starbreeze back. You have no idea how important she is.
